topic.title: SDK Authentication
topic.shortdesc: RBAC requires that users pass appropriate credentials to Couchbase Server in order to access cluster-resources. The SDK provides enhanced support for the passing of credentials.

section.title: Authentication, Credentials, and Authenticators
section.p: To access cluster-resources, a program must authenticate, as a user, with Couchbase Server. Once identified, the user may be granted resource-access, based on the roles with which they are associated.

The passing of credentials differs slightly, depending on the language that is being used. In some cases, username and password are specified explicitly whenever authentication with the cluster occurs. In other cases, an authenticator object is provided: this allows credentials to be specified during instantiation of the authenticator object, and the object subsequently passed multiple times — facilitating authentication when performed in sequence across multiple clusters.
Code examples for Node.js, Java, Python, PHP, Go, C, and .NET are provided in the section Getting Started with the SDK.

section.title: Further Information on RBAC
section.p: All aspects of the Couchbase RBAC system are covered in the section Authorization. Specifically, for information on:

ul.li: Adding Users and assigning roles, by means of the Couchbase Web Console, see Creating and Managing Users with the UI.
Roles required for resource-access, and the privileges they entail, see RBAC for Applications.
Resources controlled by Couchbase RBAC, see Resources Under Access Control.
